com.berbils.game.entities.projectilespawner.projectiletype

Class ExplodingBulletCircle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berbils.game.entities.entitytype.Entity
      • com.berbils.game.entities.entitytype.CircleGameEntity
        • com.berbils.game.entities.projectilespawner.projectiletype.Projectiles
          • com.berbils.game.entities.projectilespawner.projectiletype.ExplodingBulletCircle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ExplodingBulletCircle
extends Projectiles
    Class used for creating simple circle projectiles that explode on collision
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExplodingBulletCircle

        public ExplodingBulletCircle(float projectileSpeed,
                             float projectileDiam,
                             int damage,
                             float explosionDiam,
                             float maxRange,
                             float knockbackPower,
                             java.lang.String textureFilePath,
                             SpriteHandler spriteHandler,
                             boolean canHitFireEng)
        Constructor defines the Explosion object to be used to create the explosions and will create the fixture and body definition using the passed arguments
        Parameters:
        projectileSpeed - The speed at which the projectile travels in meters
        projectileDiam - The diameter size of the projectile in meters
        damage - The damage each projectile does on collision
        explosionDiam - The diameter of the resulting explosion once collision occurs, determines the size of the explosion texture and the range at which damage and knockback occurs
        maxRange - The max distance in meters the projectile can travel before being destroyed, acting the same as if it had collided
        knockbackPower - The amount of knockback an explosion will apply to Fire Engines in the explosion radius
        textureFilePath - The file path to the texture for the sprite, note - If this is null a sprite will not be created
        screen - The Screen containing the world where the projectile will be created

      • prepareSerialisation

        public void prepareSerialisation()
        Description copied from class: Entity
        Prepare to be serialised @Assessment 4

        Effectively null-ifies all attrs linked to global state

        Note; these *must* be recovered if the Entity is to work again

        Overrides:

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        This update method is used to ensure Explosion textures dissapear after the correct amount of time and that projectiles can only travel a max distance of their max range as defined.
        Overrides:
        update in class Projectiles
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - The time in seconds that have elapsed in world time (Excludes time taken to draw, render etc) since the last Gdx delta call.

      • collided

        public void collided(Fixture projectile)
        Destroys the projectile and its associated sprite, also calls the explosion effect and removes the projectile from a list so its distance from its spawn point is no longer checked
        Specified by:
        collided in class Projectiles
        Parameters:
        projectile - The projectile's (fixture) that collided with another Box2d object
